item.title: Python 3.10: Pattern matching with match/case
item.description: I’ve been reading Fluent Python and learnt about pattern matching with the match/case statement, introduced in Python 3.10. You can use it instead of places where you’d otherwise use if, elif, else statements. I created a small example to understand how it works. The following function takes in a list where the first argument should be foo, followed by a variable number of arguments, which we print to the console:
